titles.title: A bill to provide for the orderly implementation of Environmental Protection Agency programs established to comply with the Endangered Species Act of 1973.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.

bill.summary: 11/4/1987--Introduced. Requires the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and the Secretary of the Interior jointly to study the economic impact of any change in pesticide regulations which may be proposed in compliance with the Endangered Species Act of 1973 and report to the chairmen of specified congressional committees on the results. Directs the Administrator and Secretary jointly to inform affected persons of requirements which may be imposed under such Act. Prohibits the Administrator from cancelling or suspending a pesticide registration or finding a pesticide misbranded on the basis of noncompliance with such Act for a period commencing on enactment and ending on January 31, 1989.
